0.title: Thank god you were born: Virat Kohli to Anushka Sharma on her b'day
0.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli, taking to Instagram, penned a note to wish his wife and actress Anushka Sharma on her 34th birthday. Sharing a picture with Anushka, Virat wrote, "Thank god you were born. I don't know what I would do without you. You're truly beautiful inside out." Reacting to this, Anushka commented, "Stole my words and my heart (CHEEESSSSYYYYY)."

1.title: Suman Bery takes charge as NITI Aayog Vice Chairperson
1.article_body: Economist Dr Suman K Bery on Sunday took charge as the Vice Chairperson of NITI Aayog, according to an official statement. "NITI Aayog's challenge is to...work with India's states, which is where economic development ultimately happens," the statement quoted Bery as saying. Bery has replaced Dr Rajiv Kumar, who had taken over as the Vice Chairperson in 2017.

2.title: Eid-ul-Fitr to be celebrated on May 3 as moon not sighted today
2.article_body: Eid-ul-Fitr will be celebrated on May 3 (Tuesday), the Markaz Chand Committee of Lucknow announced on Sunday. In an official statement, the committee said that the new crescent moon could not be sighted today. Eid-ul-Fitr, which is also known as Meethi Eid, is celebrated on the first day of Shawaal.

3.title: K'taka govt clears 60 projects worth ₹2,466 cr, to create 8,575 jobs
3.article_body: The Karnataka government approved 60 new industrial projects worth ₹2,465.94 crore, which will generate over 8,575 jobs, during the 131st State-level single-window clearance committee (SLSWCC) meeting on Saturday. As per the official statement, 10 large and medium-size projects worth over ₹50 crore each, 49 projects worth ₹15 crore to ₹50 crore each and one ₹5 crore-project were cleared.

4.title: Russian 'smart mines' deployed for the 1st time in Ukraine, can identify tanks
4.article_body: Russian troops in Ukraine have started deploying 'smart mines' that have reportedly never been seen on the battlefield before. The PTKM-1R can distinguish between tanks and non-military vehicles and can launch itself up to 100 feet in the air, reports said. The mines can scan the ground and rain explosives at their targets from above.

5.title: SRH's Umran Malik bowls the fastest delivery of IPL 2022
5.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik on Sunday bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022, clocking 154 kmph against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) opener Ruturaj Gaikwad in his second over of the match. Umran overtook Gujarat Titans (GT) fast bowler Lockie Ferguson, who had clocked 153.9 kmph. Umran has bowled four of the five fastest deliveries in IPL 2022.

6.title: Thousands join anti-govt protests in Sri Lanka amid worsening crisis
6.article_body: Thousands of people in Sri Lanka joined protests against the government on Sunday amid a worsening economic crisis in the country. The protesters were led by the Sri Lankan opposition parties. "So many people are suffering from the cost of fuel and food. There are queues for everything," Sunil Shantha, a 58-year-old university lecturer, said.

7.title: World-beating retail revolution, bravo: Mahindra to Nilekani on e-comm project
7.article_body: Anand Mahindra praised Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani for helping the government in building the open network for digital commerce (ONDC). "We're on the brink of a world-beating retail revolution," tweeted Mahindra. He added, "This will democratise e-commerce, liberating us from the dominance of a few giants & empowering millions of small shop owners...Bravo Nandan Nilekani."

8.title: India to build 1st indigenous hydrogen-fuelled electric vessel
8.article_body: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways has decided to develop India's first indigenous hydrogen-fuelled electric vessel at Cochin Shipyard Ltd (CSL). The Ministry said the vessel will cost  ₹17.50 crore, of which 75% will be funded by the Central government. The hydrogen-based fuel cells are environment-friendly and already being used in bus, truck, and train applications, it added.

9.title: Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 isn't psychological thriller like part one: Bazmee
9.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee has said that his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' is not a psychological thriller like the Akshay Kumar-starrer and added that the sequel is a horror-comedy. "I was clear I didn't want to make a psychological thriller. If I had made it that way, there would have been direct comparisons," Bazmee stated. The film features Kartik Aaryan.

10.title: Tripathi has serious chance of getting a spot in India's T20I team: Steyn
10.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn said middle-order batter Rahul Tripathi, who has scored 228 runs in IPL 2022 so far, has a "serious" chance of getting a place in India's T20I squad. "Given that the position he bats at [number three] is occupied by Virat Kohli in Indian team, it's going to be difficult to get that spot," he stated.

11.title: Russia should seize West's assets over 'theft' of Russian money: Lawmaker
11.article_body: Russia should confiscate property owned by Westerners in country in response to US' suggestion of transferring frozen assets of Russian oligarchs to help Ukraine, senior Russian lawmaker Vyacheslav Volodin said on Sunday. "The proceeds from...sale [of Western assets] should be used for the development of our country," Volodin said, adding that US, Lithuania engaged in "theft" of Russian assets.

12.title: 9 arrested over building collapse in China's Changsha city
12.article_body: The Chinese Police have arrested nine people, including the owner, following the collapse of a building in China's Changsha city, according to state media. These include three people in charge of design and construction and five others who gave a false safety assessment of a guest house in the building. About 20 people remain trapped in the rubble.

13.title: Centre will give additional power supply to UP: CM Adityanath
13.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday said the Centre will give additional power supply and the Indian Railways will provide extra rakes to transport coal in the state. "As of now, the power situation is normal in the state," Adityanath said and directed officials to ensure power supply according to the roster. "Don't make unnecessary power cuts," he added.

14.title: Govt issues public health advisory to states amid ongoing heatwave
14.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave, the Union Health Ministry has written to all states to disseminate the guideline document 'National Action Plan on Heat-Related Illnesses' to all districts for effective management. The Health Secretary said health facilities need to increase resilience to extreme heat by arranging uninterrupted electricity for constant functioning of cooling appliances.

15.title: LIC getting bids twice the size of its IPO anchor book: Report
15.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO is getting bids twice the size of its anchor book, Bloomberg reported. LIC's anchor book, which contains a list of institutional investors for its IPO, will be announced on Monday. Singapore's GIC Private Limited and Norway's sovereign wealth fund are reportedly among the list of anchor investors for LIC's ₹20,557-crore IPO.

16.title: LSG batting order is fragile without KL Rahul: Jaffer
16.article_body: Wasim Jaffer has said LSG's batting line-up is "fragile" without skipper KL Rahul despite having good finishers in Ayush Badoni, Marcus Stoinis and Jason Holder. "If Rahul scores runs, they reach the score which they want, like 170-180 or more," he added. LSG posted 195/3 in 20 overs, with Rahul top-scoring(77) for the side against DC in IPL on Sunday.

17.title: Due to tukde-tukde gang's actions: Rijiju as UK MP criticises PM Boris for JCB pic
17.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju reacted to UK MP Nadia Whittome's criticism of UK PM Boris Johnson's picture on a JCB machine by saying, "I don't blame [her]." Rijiju said Whittome was "unaware of reality", adding, "It's the result of the negative campaigns launched by the Tukde-Tukde gang whose only aim is to discredit huge achievements of PM Narendra Modi's government."

18.title: There's no 4th wave of COVID-19 in India so far: ICMR
18.article_body: Recent COVID-19 data indicate localised spike in cases in some districts and not the onset of a fourth wave, ICMR's Additional DG Samiran Panda told TOI. "What we're seeing are blips and not the start of a new COVID-19 wave," he said. On the spike in COVID-19 positivity rates in some regions, he said it's mostly due to low testing.

19.title: LSG defeat DC to win 3rd match in a row, move to 2nd on the points table
19.article_body: LSG defeated DC by six runs to register their third victory in a row in IPL 2022. With the win, LSG have moved to the second position on the points table. LSG captain KL Rahul top-scored in the match with 77(51), while LSG pacer Mohsin Khan registered bowling figures of 4-0-16-4.

20.title: Zaheer was one of the most skillful bowlers I've ever faced: Smith
20.article_body: Praising Zaheer Khan, Graeme Smith said the ex-India pacer was one of the most skillful bowlers that he ever faced in his career. "He got the ball to swing away...had a great change of pace. He bowled well with the reverse-swinging ball," he added. Notably, Zaheer dismissed the ex-South Africa skipper on 14 occasions in 27 matches in international cricket.

21.title: Pics show huge traffic in U'khand as tourists rush to Dhanaulti
21.article_body: Amid rising temperatures in parts of the country, huge number of tourists were seen in Uttarakhand's Dhanaulti. Pictures show cars lined up bumper to bumper in the area. The hill states of Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh, which are close to Delhi, witness huge number of tourists every year.

22.title: Gupta brothers used ex-Prez Zuma against people of S Africa: Report
22.article_body: Indian-born brothers Atul and Rajesh Gupta had used ex-President Jacob Zuma against the people of South Africa, according to the latest report from Commission of Inquiry into Allegations of State Capture. Zuma had also installed lackeys of the Gupta brothers at key institutions, it said. Zuma "would do anything that the Guptas wanted him to do for them", it added.

23.title: CIA's first-ever CTO Nand Mulchandani studied at a Delhi school
23.article_body: Nand Mulchandani, appointed as the US Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) first Chief Technology Officer (CTO), did his schooling at Delhi's Bluebells School International. He has a degree in Computer Science and Math from Cornell and a Master of Science in Management from Stanford Business School. The Indian-American also learned Public Administration at Harvard's Kennedy School of Government.

24.title: There's never a shortage of funding for good ideas: Shark Tank's Ghazal
24.article_body: Mamaearth Co-founder and Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh said there's never a shortage of funding for good ideas. Speaking at a TiEcon event in Chandigarh, Alagh added, "I faced a lot of challenges when I first wanted to bring my idea into fruition. It is always better to take risks...than to bear the pain of regret later on."

25.title: Became suicidal in a relationship, tried to cut my hands: Payal
25.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi has said that she was suicidal in a relationship in the past and revealed that she tried cutting her hands. "There was this love angle, which was very detrimental in my personal life. Got heavily into drinking...I used to be on prescribed drugs," she stated on the show. The actress is currently dating Sangram Singh.

26.title: BJP MP starts campaign seeking withdrawal of quota for tribal converts
26.article_body: Madhya Pradesh BJP MP GS Damor said tribals who convert to any other religion mustn't be given reservations mandated for Scheduled Tribes.  "We have been organising delisting rallies in all tribal-dominated districts," Damor said. Reacting to Damor's comments, state Youth Congress chief Vikrant Bhuria said Damor should be "ashamed as he himself is an MP from an ST reserved seat".

27.title: Fighter pilot wrongly identified as 'Ghost of Kyiv'; 'it's a legend', says Ukraine
27.article_body: The 29-year-old Ukrainian fighter pilot Stepan Tarabalka, who was recently killed in battle with Russians, isn't the 'Ghost of Kyiv' and didn't hit 40 planes as has been claimed, Ukraine Air Force Command said. "'Ghost of Kyiv' is a superhero legend whose character was created by Ukrainians!" it added. Tarabalka was killed in an air battle on March 13.

28.title: Greece lifts COVID-19 curbs for travellers ahead of tourism season
28.article_body: Greece on Sunday lifted restrictions for domestic and foreign flights, its civil aviation authority announced. The move, which is set to aid summer tourism in country, will now only require travellers to wear face masks, lifting need for them to produce vaccination certificate or a negative COVID-19 test. "All measures will be reviewed on September 1,” Greek Health Minister said.

29.title: SRH to bowl first against CSK as Dhoni returns as captain, CSK make 2 changes
29.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. The match is MS Dhoni's first as captain in IPL 2022 after Ravindra Jadeja handed back captaincy to him. CSK have made two changes to their team, with Devon Conway and Simarjeet Singh replacing Shivam Dube and Dwayne Bravo.

30.title: Real Madrid's Ancelotti becomes 1st manager to win Europe's top 5 leagues
30.article_body: After Real Madrid won their 35th La Liga title, head coach Carlo Ancelotti has become the first manager to win league titles in all top five leagues of Europe. Ancelotti won the Serie A title with AC Milan. Ancelotti won the Premier League with Chelsea and Ligue 1 title with PSG. He also won the Bundesliga with Bayern Munich.

31.title: Ganguly, Dhoni used to think out-of-the-box, Pant is similar: Latif
31.article_body: Naming his choice for next India captain in limited-overs cricket, ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said Rishabh Pant is a good option. "Players like Sourav Ganguly, Mohammad Azharuddin, MS Dhoni were different, they used to think out-of-the-box. Pant is similar in that way, he's unique," he added. Meanwhile, Pant-led DC have four wins from eight matches so far in IPL 2022.

32.title: Murdoch, Shankar's Bodhi Tree to invest $600 million in ALLEN Career Institute
32.article_body: Bodhi Tree, the investment firm backed by James Murdoch and former Disney executive Uday Shankar, is investing $600 million in ALLEN Career Institute. Bodhi Tree said that its investment in the 33-year-old test prep institute is strategic in nature. Founded by Rajesh Maheshwari in 1988, ALLEN operates 138 classroom centres in 46 cities across India and the Middle East.

33.title: BJP's purpose behind UCC is to target minorities: CPI(M) leader
33.article_body: Senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Hannan Mollah on Sunday said that Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh and BJP's purpose behind bringing the Uniform Civil Code is to target the minorities of the country. His response came following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's comment stating, "No Muslim woman wants her husband to bring home three other wives. Ask any Muslim woman."

34.title: Why option of merging Pawan Hans with ONGC wasn't explored?: Cong
34.article_body: Congress on Sunday questioned disinvestment of the Centre's 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited (PHL) and asked why the Centre didn't explore merging PHL with Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC). Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh said the Centre is "committing a series of blunders" and that the Pawan Hans employee union had also recommended merging PHL with ONGC.

35.title: Vietnam, Japan criticise use of force in Ukraine, call for war to end
35.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and his Vietnamese counterpart Pham Minh Chinh on Sunday criticised the use of force in Ukraine and called for the war to end immediately. Kishida is currently on a visit to Vietnam. Separately, Kishida also criticised China's actions in South China Sea, where the Chinese government has constructed artificial islands and turned them into military outposts.

36.title: Southern Army Commander visits Pune's Armed Forces Medical College
36.article_body: General Officer Commanding-in-Chief Southern Command Lieutenant General JS Nain visited the Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC) and Military Intelligence Training School and Depot in Pune. At AFMC, he visited the skill laboratory which has mannequins, state-of-the-art equipment for medical training and simulators. He interacted with the faculty of the college.

37.title: Pics show Angelina posing with kids, visiting railway station in war-hit Ukraine
37.article_body: Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie visited the Ukrainian city of Lviv on Saturday amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. The actress visited a Lviv cafe, Lviv's main railway station, and met people displaced by the war with Russia. The 46-year-old actress, a special envoy for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, was heard saying, "I know how trauma affects children."

38.title: May you always shine like this: MI owner Nita Ambani to Kartikeya
38.article_body: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani congratulated debutant Kumar Kartikeya after the team registered its first win in IPL 2022 after beating Rajasthan Royals by five wickets. In a video, Nita congratulated Kartikeya on a call. "You played really well...may you always shine like this," she said. Kartikeya conceded 19 runs in his four-over bowling spell and took Sanju Samson's wicket.

39.title: Need cow shelters at block level to protect them from heat: UP CM to officials
39.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday directed officials to set up shelters that can accommodate 2,000-2,500 cows at block level in bid to protect them from heat amid soaring temperatures. "There should be proper arrangements for green fodder, straw...in...shelters," CM Yogi said. UP government recently announced that it's mulling setting up "cow sanctuaries" for abandoned cattle in 30 districts.

40.title: Some after El Clasico celebrated as if they had won La Liga: Courtois
40.article_body: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois, referring to Barcelona's 4-0 El Clasico win, said "some" players celebrated as if they had won La Liga. After Real Madrid won La Liga, Courtois said, "Some celebrated as if they had...won the title, that they had come back [to our level]." Barcelona defender Gerrard Pique had tweeted "We are back" after winning against Madrid.

41.title: Assamese Muslims don’t wish to be mixed with migrant Muslims: Assam CM
41.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that Assam's indigenous Muslim population does not wish to "mix" with migrant Muslims living in the state. "It [state government] will take a decision in the future on who is a Muslim and who is a migrant Muslim. There is no opposition to this in Assam," CM Sarma said.

42.title: Man beaten to death over land dispute with nephew in Rajasthan
42.article_body: A man from Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu was allegedly beaten to death by his nephew and two others on April 28 over a land dispute, police said. The accused attacked the victim, Hem Singh, with rods and sprinkled chilli powder in his eyes. "They hit him on his...chest and head with rods which led to his bones being crushed," the FIR said.

43.title: Ayurveda startup by Gujarat student gets ₹2.5 crore funding at govt summit
43.article_body: Neelkanth Mardia, a final year student of Institute of Teaching and Research in Ayurveda, Gujarat, received ₹2.5 crore in funding from a private company at a summit organised by the Ayush Ministry. Mardia started Ayurveda-based cosmetic company Green Forest Wellness with ₹5 lakh in 2021. However, he wasn't able to expand it due to lack of funds, the Ministry said.

44.title: A confidence-building knock: Gavaskar on Kohli's half-century vs GT
44.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli's knock of 53-ball 58 against Gujarat Titans, ex-India batter Sunil Gavaskar has said that it was a knock that the former India captain needed. "It's a confidence-building innings. As far as the RCB is concerned, they will be...very happy," he added. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Kohli has scored 186 runs in 10 matches so far.

45.title: Won't participate in MNS' Hanuman Chalisa event in Maha: VHP
45.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) National Spokesperson Vinod Bansal on Sunday said VHP and Bajrang Dal activists won't participate in the event being organised by Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques on May 3. "[VHP] doesn't support any political party", Bansal said and added that VHP believes there shouldn't be a ban on recitation of Hanuman Chalisa.

46.title: Mumbai Police received 84 applications for use of loudspeakers
46.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday said that the police received 84 applications for the use of loudspeakers in the city. "Most of the applications are legal and have been approved by the police," he added. Notably, this comes amid the ongoing controversy over usage of loudspeakers at religious places.

47.title: 'Kashmir Files' depiction of KP exodus is false', says Wiki page; Director reacts
47.article_body: 'Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri shared a screenshot of the film's Wikipedia page which called the movie's 'genocidal' depiction of the Kashmir Pandit (KP) exodus "inaccurate and associated with conspiracy theories". Agnihotri said, "Dear Wikipedia, You forgot to add 'Islamophobia...propaganda...sanghi...bigot...etc'. You are failing your Secular credentials. Hurry, edit more."

48.title: Oh my god, 365 days ago I was in exam hall: US Open champion Raducanu
48.article_body: Reflecting on her past 12 months from being a school student to becoming a Grand Slam champion, world number 11 Emma Raducanu said, "Oh my god, like 365 days ago, I was literally sitting in an exam hall doing paper three." The 19-year-old became the first-ever qualifier to win a Grand Slam title at US Open in September last year.

49.title: India's pharma exports hit ₹1.83 lakh crore in FY22: Govt
49.article_body: Pharma exports touched ₹1,83,422 crore in 2021-22 against ₹90,415 crore in 2013-14, a 103% rise in eight years, the Commerce Ministry said. It added that currently, 60% of the world's vaccines and 20% of generic medicines come from India. The pharma exports in FY22 sustained a positive growth despite trade disruptions and drop in demand for coronavirus-related medicines, it stated.

50.title: BJP MLA arrested from official residence for assaulting Odisha officer
50.article_body: Odisha BJP MLA Subash Chandra Panigrahi has been arrested from his official residence in Bhubaneswar for allegedly assaulting a block development officer (BDO) in Deogarh. His two aides have also been arrested. The BDO alleged that the MLA and his associates attacked him when they could not find him at his office as he was busy with some official work.

51.title: Scheme to provide loans to inmates in Maha prisons launched in Pune
51.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil launched a scheme to provide loans to inmates undergoing long-term sentences, at a function held at the Yerawada Central Prison in Pune. The initiative has been launched by Maharashtra State Cooperative Bank for inmates with the aim to provide financial assistance for the livelihood of their families, said a tweet from Patil's Twitter handle.

52.title: Cyberabad Police warn job aspirants against submitting false details
52.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Sunday warned aspirants against submitting fake credentials for job vacancies listed by Telangana State Level Police Recruitment Board. "We'll register cases against those who give any false details. Candidates should take due care in this regard," police tweeted. Vacancies were listed in police, special protection force, fire department, jail department, transport and excise.

53.title: India's current Army, Navy & Air Force chiefs had graduated together from NDA
53.article_body: The three chiefs of India's armed forces- Army, Navy and Air Force- were batchmates of the 61st National Defence Academy (NDA) course. The Indian Army on Sunday shared a picture of the three military chiefs General Manoj Pande (Army), Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari and Admiral R Hari Kumar (Navy) and said, "Tri-services synergy at its best!"

54.title: I avoid things that are evil, stupid & make me look bad; Bitcoin does all 3: Munger
54.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway's Vice-Chairman Charlie Munger said, "I avoid things that are stupid, evil, and make me look bad in comparison to someone else." The billionaire added, "Bitcoin does all three." He said Bitcoin is "stupid" because he expects it to go to zero, "evil" because it undermines US financial system's integrity, and makes other countries "look foolish" compared to China.

55.title: Musk takes feedback better than Zuckerberg: Facebook whistleblower
55.article_body: Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen said that Elon Musk, who is buying Twitter for $44 billion, is better able to take hard feedback and make meaningful changes than Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg. "[Zuckerberg has] surrounded himself with people who tell him what he wants to hear," Haugen stated. She added that she's "cautiously optimistic" about Musk's takeover of Twitter.

56.title: Observe ‘Black May Day’: Sri Lankan leader to people amid economic crisis
56.article_body: In a message issued on International Labour Day, Opposition Sri Lankan leader Sajith Premadasa urged the country's residents to observe a "Black May Day" this year amid its ongoing economic crisis. Premadasa stated that the government's "recklessness" had pushed the country towards the brink of bankruptcy. Sri Lanka is facing an acute shortage of essential supplies, including food and medicines.

57.title: 77-yr-old man robbed, killed inside his house in Delhi's Civil Lines
57.article_body: A 77-year-old man was allegedly robbed and murdered by unidentified men inside his house in North Delhi's Civil Lines, police said. The victim was sleeping alone when the accused broke into his house, robbed cash from the room and attacked him with a weapon, police added. The deceased had four knife injuries, said Sagar Singh Kalsi, DCP (north).

58.title: B'luru's Hoodi Lake restored at ₹2.5 cr, now it's free from sewage
58.article_body: The Hoodi Lake in Mahadevapura zone in Bengaluru has been restored at a cost of ₹2.5 crore. A BBMP official said there were plans to construct a walking path as well but there is a huge shortage of fund. "The lake is now in a good state. It is free from sewage and properly fenced," a lake activist said.

59.title: Was important for me to play till end: MI's Suryakumar after win vs RR
59.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 39-ball 51 against RR in IPL 2022, said it was important for him to play till the end. "But my job at number three was to take the game ahead from where Rohit Sharma left," he added. MI beat RR by five wickets on Saturday.

60.title: Couldn't take picture with Hrithik at 'Koi..' premiere, was heartbroken: Pooja
60.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde said she was heartbroken that she could not take a picture with actor Hrithik Roshan at the premiere of 'Koi...Mil Gaya'. "He came...for 10 minutes, he said hi to everyone...and he left...There is picture of me...all sad next to...his poster of 'Koi...Mil Gaya'...I wanna go back...and be like, 'One day...you'll have...full film with Hrithik Roshan'," she added.

61.title: He added magic in song 'It's magic': Hrithik on 'Koi Mil...' singer Taz's demise
61.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan remembered singer Tarsame Singh Saini, popularly known as Taz from Stereo Nation, who passed away on Friday at the age of 54. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Taz added the magic, in 'It's magic' from 'Koi Mil Gaya' with his soulful voice." "Prayers and strength to his family. You will be missed," he added.

62.title: I will definitely take this win: Rohit on MI's 1st win in IPL 2022
62.article_body: After winning their first game of the ongoing IPL 2022, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma has said that he will "definitely take this win". "This is how we play and our real potential came out today (Saturday)," Sharma said after beating Rajasthan Royals by five wickets. "The conditions were different...the ball grips more here (DY Patil Stadium)," he said.

63.title: The rib has been very disabling: Rafael Nadal ahead of Madrid Open
63.article_body: Rafael Nadal, who sustained a rib injury during the BNP Paribas Open, has said that he has trained "very little" for the upcoming Madrid Open. "I arrived very tight...The rib has been very disabling...I haven't been able to do practically anything," he stated. Nadal added he has Roland Garros in mind, and said, "I'm aware...this tournament in Madrid is difficult."

64.title: Allahabad HC issues non-bailable warrant against Mathura DM
64.article_body: For allegedly "disrespecting" the court's order on the payment of pension, the Allahabad High Court has issued a non-bailable warrant against Mathura's District Magistrate Navneet Singh Chahal.  After observing that the April 18 order passed by the DM is nothing but a "gross contemptuous act", Justice Saral Srivastava directed the police to produce DM on the next date of hearing.

65.title: 6-month-old girl & her disabled sister raped in Delhi; 1 arrested
65.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested on Saturday for allegedly raping a six-month-old girl in Delhi's Samaypur Badli area, police said. His friend, who raped the minor's 14-year-old intellectually disabled sister, is absconding, police added. The complainant informed the police that she found the accused allegedly raping her daughters on Friday evening, adding that they escaped after seeing her.

66.title: India has enough edible oil stock: Govt amid Indonesia's export ban
66.article_body: Amid Indonesia's palm oil export ban, the Centre said India has enough stock of edible oil. The present stock of all edible oils is around 21 lakh metric tonne (LMT) and another 12 LMT will arrive in May, the government added. Edible oils' prices are being watched closely so that appropriate measures can be taken to keep prices under control.

67.title: Video shows tornado ripping through Kansas in US; hundreds of buildings destroyed
67.article_body: A video shows a tornado ripping through parts of Kansas in US. The tornado destroyed hundreds of homes and buildings, injured several people and left more than 15,000 people without power, officials said. Moreover, three University of Oklahoma meteorology students traveling back from storm chasing in Kansas were killed in a crash, according to officials.

68.title: It will redefine the action genre for Indian cinema: Kangana on 'Dhaakad'
68.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her upcoming film 'Dhaakad', said it will redefine the action genre for Indian cinema. "It has been...long-standing dream of mine to take up challenging parts and be part of movies that change the norm," she added. Kangana, who plays the lead role in the film, further said she enjoyed playing agent Agni "who stops at nothing".

69.title: 2 govt employees beaten with sticks by villagers in UP
69.article_body: Two employees of the Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited were allegedly beaten with sticks by villagers of Takia village, Budaun on Sunday. The two employees, identified as Fukran Hussain and Nafees Ahmed, had gone to the village to rectify a faulty line, police said. Incidentally, on Friday, an SP MLA allegedly assaulted a UPPCL employee in the district as well.

70.title: KSRTC waives off over 7,000 employee disciplinary cases on Labour Day
70.article_body: As many as 7,200 employee disciplinary cases of Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) were waived off on Sunday on the occasion of International Labour Day, a statement by KSRTC read. "Employees who were absent from duty for less than ten months are exempted from...disciplinary proceedings," it added. Fines ranging between ₹100 and ₹500 have been levied on these employees.

71.title: Mumbai man kills friend for asking to return money, dumps body in water
71.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a 22-year-old man for strangulating his 18-year-old friend using a cable wire after she asked him to return the money she had lent to him. The man packed her body in a sack and threw it in the water at Madh beach. He had asked for a friend's scooter to take the body to the beach.

72.title: Pakistan govt channel fails to cover PM's event, 17 of its employees fired
72.article_body: Seventeen employees of Pakistan's state-run PTV channel have been fired for failing to cover PM Shehbaz Sharif's event in Lahore last week. PTV reportedly failed to ensure "proper" coverage due to the non-availability of an advanced laptop for uploading the video footage. The sacked employees reportedly said they were 'scapegoated' by the administration appointed by Pakistan's previous regime.

73.title: Andy Cohen welcomes baby girl via surrogacy, shares pic
73.article_body: American television talk show host Andy Cohen took to his social media handles to announce that he has welcomed a baby girl via surrogacy. Sharing a picture of his daughter, the 53-year-old wrote, "Meet my daughter, Lucy Eve Cohen! Thank you to my rock star surrogate (ALL surrogates are rockstars, by the way) and everyone who helped...make this miracle happen."

74.title: Stuart Broad & I were hoping our careers weren't over: James Anderson
74.article_body: Veteran England pacer James Anderson has opened up about the England cricket board's Managing Director Rob Key's statement that Anderson and Stuart Broad could feature for England this summer. "Stuart and I were hoping our careers weren't over," he stated. "Because of the situation...you're just...unsure of what's going to happen. So now having that clarity is really nice," he added.

75.title: I haven't been home for 9 years: MI debutant Kumar Kartikeya
75.article_body: Spinner Kumar Kartikeya, who made his debut for MI against RR on Saturday, revealed he hasn't been home for nine years. "I'd decided to return home only when I achieve something in life. My mom and dad called me frequently, but I was committed. Now finally I'll return home after...IPL," the 24-year-old, who represents Madhya Pradesh in domestic cricket, said.

76.title: Upto ₹10,000 fine, jail for those plying unfit vehicles in Delhi
76.article_body: Delhi's Transport Department said owners and drivers of vehicles, including those of government departments, found plying without a valid fitness certificate could be fined upto ₹10,000 or be jailed. They could be fined between ₹2,000-5,000 for first offence and ₹5,000-10,000 for subsequent offences. Vehicle owners will also have to pay renewal fee for their vehicle's certificate of registration.

77.title: TN medical college students administered Charak oath; notice issued
77.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Directorate of Medical Education has issued a notice and sought an explanation after first-year students at Madurai Government Medical College were administered the Charak oath instead of the Hippocratic oath on Saturday. An official release said that this was "strongly condemnable". The dean of the state-run college was also relieved of his post and put on a waitlist.

78.title: Multiple Grammy Award winner Naomi Judd dies of mental illness at 76
78.article_body: American singer and actress Naomi Judd, a five-time Grammy award winner, passed away on Saturday at the age of 76. "We lost our beautiful mother to the disease of mental illness. We are shattered," her daughter Ashley Judd said in a statement on Twitter. Mourning her demise, American singer-songwriter Carrie Underwood said, "Country music lost a true legend."

79.title: Carolina Marin wins her 6th European Championships title
79.article_body: Former world number one shuttler Carolina Marin won her sixth European Championships title after beating Kirsty Gilmour of Scotland by 21-10 and 21-12 on Saturday. The 28-year-old shuttler, who made her comeback after a gap of ten months, said, "I feel extremely happy...Being able to come back and play my first tournament of the season is bigger."

80.title: Delhi-NCR 9th most costly office market in Asia-Pacific: Report
80.article_body: Delhi-NCR is the ninth most expensive prime office space market in Asia-Pacific with an occupancy cost of $60 per square feet per year, Knight Frank's Asia-Pacific Prime Office Rental Index for Q1 2022 revealed. The region's most expensive office markets are Hong Kong ($186) and Singapore ($105). Mumbai ($50.9) and Bengaluru ($26.7) are at 15th and 21st positions respectively.

81.title: EMIs to rise as HDFC hikes lending rate on housing loans
81.article_body: Mortgage lender HDFC has increased its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on housing loans, on which its Adjustable Rate Home Loans (ARHL) are benchmarked, by 5 basis points. The hiked rate, which will increase EMI for existing borrowers, comes into effect from May 1, 2022, HDFC Ltd said. There is no change in the lending for new borrowers.

82.title: My 23rd b'day was very special, I signed my debut film with JP Dutta: Abhishek
82.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan in an interview spoke about his 23rd birthday and said, "[It] was a long time ago! But I...remember it clearly. It was very special." "My birthday falls on February 5, and I...signed my first film, 'Refugee' with Mr JP Dutta on February 1," he added. "I was sure at 23 I wanted to become an actor," said Abhishek.

83.title: I hope it doesn't affect Jadeja: Irfan Pathan on CSK captaincy change
83.article_body: Reacting to all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni after six defeats in their eight games in the ongoing IPL season, former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said, "I really feel for Jadeja." Irfan added, "Let's hope it doesn't affect him as a cricketer in a negative way." Jadeja has scored 112 runs in the season so far.

84.title: New Zealand reports first case of Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19
84.article_body: New Zealand reported its first known case of Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19 after a person who had travelled from overseas tested positive for it, said the country's Ministry of Health on Sunday. Nearly 12,700 community cases were also detected during the weekend, it added. Two other sub-variants of Omicron were also detected in two overseas returnees.

85.title: Not a bad idea: Musk on using Dogecoin to authenticate humans on Twitter
85.article_body: Elon Musk, who is acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, said it's "not a bad idea" to use Dogecoin to authenticate humans on Twitter. He was responding to billionaire investor Mark Cuban's idea of Twitter users putting up one Dogecoin for unlimited posts. "If anyone contests a post and humans confirm it's spam, they get the spammer's Doge," the investor said.

86.title: Matter of pride for me to lead Indian Army: General Manoj Pande
86.article_body: A day after taking charge, Army Chief General Manoj Pande said it's a matter of pride for him that he has been asked to lead Indian Army. "It has a glorious past that maintained the security and integrity of the nation," he said. The Army chief added, "The geopolitical situation is changing rapidly and we have many challenges before us."

87.title: It was challenging to perform courtroom scene with Big B: Rakul on Runway 34
87.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh spoke about the challenges she faced during the filming of 'Runway 34', where she had to act in front of actor Amitabh Bachchan. She said, "Most challenging part was to perform the courtroom scene with Mr. Bachchan." "I had to show the tension and vulnerability without showing any retaliation or dialogues at the beginning," she added.

88.title: Some residents in Mumbai to be trained in disaster management
88.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said that it plans to provide disaster management training to people living in landslide-prone areas. Since many of these landslide-prone locations have access issues and nearby residents are first responders to calamities, training them will help in saving lives, it added. In 2021, over 290 landslide-prone areas were identified in Mumbai by the BMC.

89.title: Won’t allow any loss of territory: New Army chief on standoff with China
89.article_body: Army Chief General Manoj Pande, while talking about the standoff with China along the Line of Actual Control, said Indian troops are holding important physical positions. "We are very clear that we'll not permit any change in the status quo and any loss of territory," he added. He further said, "We have re-aligned our troops after carrying out threat assessments."

90.title: Impressed with planning of 2032 Brisbane Olympics Games: IOC Prez
90.article_body: International Olympic Council (IOC) President Thomas Bach has said that he is "impressed" with the commencement of the planning of the 2032 Olympic Games in Brisbane. "[O]ff to a really wonderful start...We are extremely impressed by the quality of the board of the organising committee, by the diversity," Bach said after IOC's first meeting with Brisbane organisers.

91.title: My favourite designer called me to his hotel room, we had sex: Saisha Shinde
91.article_body: Saisha Shinde revealed on 'Lock Upp' that a designer once invited her to his hotel room. She said, "This is one secret that I never brought out. This Indian designer was my favourite. He called me to his hotel room, I hugged him, and...we had sex." "He had done the same with at least 7 to 8 boys," Saisha added.

92.title: He's bashing the door down as hard as he can: Steyn on Rahul Tripathi
92.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn has praised batter Rahul Tripathi for his performance in the IPL, stating that the 31-year-old is "bashing the [Team India] door down as hard as he can". Steyn added, "The way Tripathi is playing and the way he has played, he has certainly matured." Rahul has scored 228 runs in eight games in IPL 2022.

93.title: 5 Galgotias University students hit by car in Greater Noida, 1 dead
93.article_body: Out on their evening walk, five students of Galgotias University were hit by a speeding vehicle in Greater Noida on Saturday. According to the police, one of them, identified as Ayush Sharma (23), died during the treatment at the Kailash Hospital while four others are still recovering from their injuries. Notably, the police officials are searching for the unidentified accused.

94.title: US woman gets 2-yr felony probation for casting dead mother’s vote
94.article_body: A 64-year-old woman has been sentenced to two years of felony probation for voting her dead mother's ballot in US' Arizona in the 2020 general election. Her mother had died days before election. She was also fined and asked to perform community service, which was more lenient than what the prosecutor had sought - at least 30 days in jail.

95.title: Pak secures $8 bn financial aid from Saudi amid economic crisis: Reports
95.article_body: Amid an economic crisis in Pakistan, the country has secured financial support worth $8 billion from Saudi Arabia, multiple reports said on Sunday. The deal was secured during Pakistan PM Shahbaz Sharif's visit to Saudi, local media reported. Pakistan has been battling a crisis with high inflation, reduced forex reserves, depreciating currency and a widening current account deficit.

96.title: If a film isn't a hit, people criticise it more than it deserves: Nawazuddin
96.article_body: When asked if there's any insecurity in Bollywood after the domination of films like 'RRR' and 'KGF 2', Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "When a film does well everyone...praises it more than it...deserves. Similarly, if a film isn't a hit, people criticise it more than it deserves." "Now if a Bollywood film becomes a...hit then all these talks will change," he added.

97.title: China's COVID lockdown rules are cruel, we won’t follow them: Taiwan
97.article_body: Taiwan's Premier Su Tseng-chang has termed China's COVID-19 rules as "cruel", adding that country won't follow similar measures. Her comments come as Taiwan's experiencing a surge in COVID-19 cases with 17,085 new cases reported on Sunday. Notably, China enforced a stringent lockdown in Shanghai and had adopted measures such as erecting fences outside residential areas to arrest spread of virus.

98.title: Was told to lose weight for auditions, would leave Mumbai scarred: Flora Saini
98.article_body: Actress Flora Saini said that she was asked to lose weight for auditions and that she would leave Mumbai scarred. She also said that she has been rejected so many times and there is a lot of criticism in the industry. "People say, 'you've gained weight, you don't fit into the character'," she added.

99.title: Mumbai likely to receive pre-monsoon rainfall around May 12
99.article_body: Mumbai is likely to record pre-monsoon rainfall around May 12 due to low pressure in the Andaman sea. Heavy rains are likely in Eastern India in second week of May. A low pressure area is likely to form over the same region around May 6 and it is likely to become more marked during subsequent 24 hours.

100.title: My character in Modern Love is something I've attempted for first time: Fatima
100.article_body: Speaking about the response she garnered for the trailer of her upcoming show, 'Modern Love: Mumbai' actress Fatima Shaikh said, "The response that has been coming my way after the trailer release of...'Modern Love'...is sweet and encouraging." "My character in 'Modern Love' is something I've attempted for the...first time and this anthology is very close to my heart," she added.

101.title: ISMC to invest ₹22,900 cr to set up India's 1st chip-making plant in K'taka
101.article_body: International semiconductor consortium ISMC will invest ₹22,900 crore ($3 billion) to set up India's first and largest semiconductor fabrication unit in Karnataka, the state government announced on Sunday. ISMC is a joint venture between Abu Dhabi's Next Orbit Ventures and Israel's Tower Semiconductor. The chip-making plant is expected to generate over 1,500 direct and 10,000 indirect jobs.

102.title: World may face a recession within the next two years, warns Singapore PM
102.article_body: Singapore PM Lee Hsien Loong has warned that the world may face a recession within the next two years. Loong said that the Russia-Ukraine war has clouded Singapore's post-COVID-19 recovery outlook, adding that Singaporeans are already feeling the impact of the war on the cost of living. Singapore is facing an S$8 billion hit a year from higher energy prices.

103.title: Man dressed as sadhu sexually assaults 12-yr-old girl in Jharkhand
103.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted in Jharkhand's Khunti district by a man, who visited her house in the guise of a sadhu to seek offerings, police said on Sunday. Three men dressed as sadhus visited the girl's house and the main accused went inside to drink water when the girl ran out of the house screaming, police said.

104.title: Indian-American Nand Mulchandani to be CIA's first-ever CTO
104.article_body: Indian-American entrepreneur Nand Mulchandani has been named the US government's Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) first-ever Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Mulchandani is a serial entrepreneur who has co-founded and been CEO of startups namely Oblix, Determina, OpenDNS and ScaleXtreme. He has studied at Cornell University, Stanford Business School and Harvard's Kennedy School of Government.

105.title: Was very nervous, he made me comfortable: Sethupathi on working with Shahid
105.article_body: Vijay Sethupathi, who'll be seen sharing screen space with Shahid Kapoor in the show 'Farzi', spoke about working with Shahid and said, "I was very nervous since I had to shoot with Shahid...on the...first day." "But he made me...comfortable, especially since he'd already shot for 'Farzi' for 40 days," Vijay added. The show is being directed by Raj & DK.

106.title: Masks will be compulsory in Maha again if COVID-19 cases rise: Tope
106.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said on Sunday that the state will bring back its compulsory mask mandate if COVID-19 cases continue to rise. His comments come after Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray appealed to people to wear masks outdoors to restrict a possible "fourth wave" of COVID-19 infections. Maharashtra government made wearing masks optional for residents last month.

107.title: Don't believe permanent ban is right: Ex-Twitter CEO Dorsey
107.article_body: Ex-Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, in an apparent hint to the permanent suspension of Donald Trump's Twitter account in 2021, said he doesn't believe that any permanent ban, with the exception of illegal activity, is right. A "transparent system", both in policy and operations, is more important than whether Twitter is run by a company or an open protocol, Dorsey added.

108.title: LIC to retain some stake in IDBI Bank for bancassurance gains: Chairman
108.article_body: LIC will retain a part of its stake in IDBI Bank to reap the benefits of the bancassurance channel, Chairman MR Kumar said. He added that LIC doesn't want to "hold a big stake" but some holding as it has been a win-win for both entities. LIC had bought a 51% stake in IDBI Bank in 2019 for ₹21,624 crore.

109.title: Man wearing Zomato t-shirt, 2 teenagers killed in car-bike crash in Delhi
109.article_body: Three people, including a motorcycle rider wearing a Zomato t-shirt, died in an accident involving a car and a motorcycle in Delhi. Other two deceased have been identified as 17-year-old Jyoti and her 19-year-old sister Bharti. Police said the motorcycle was in front of the car but the sequence of events leading to the accident is yet to be established.

110.title: It's going to take some time: Producer Barbara on casting next James Bond
110.article_body: James Bond producer Barbara Broccoli said in an interview that "it's going to take some time" before Daniel Craig's replacement is named. "It's a big decision. It's not just casting a role. It's about a whole rethink about where we're going," Barbara said. 'No Time To Die', which was released in 2021, marked Daniel's final outing as the 007 agent.

111.title: Mumbai Police capable of maintaining peace in city: Commissioner
111.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday said that the city's police force is capable enough to deal with people who try to disturb the peace. He also sought the cooperation of residents in maintaining the law and order. Notably, Pandey's comments come after MNS chief Raj Thackeray's ultimatum to remove loudspeakers in mosques by May 3.

112.title: CCTV footage of Noida mall fight that led to 30-year-old man's death released
112.article_body: CCTV footage of the Gardens Galleria fight that led to the death of a 30-year-old man has surfaced. In the video, staff and bouncers of the Lost Lemons resto-bar in Noida outside which the fight took place, are seen beating one person. The fight allegedly broke out on April 25 over the bill and resulted in Brijesh Rai's death.

113.title: Me, Suryakumar wanted to take chase vs RR as deep as possible: Tilak
113.article_body: After MI's five-wicket win against RR in IPL 2022, MI batter Tilak Varma said that he and teammate Suryakumar Yadav wanted to take the 159-run chase as deep as possible. Tilak (35) and Suryakumar (51) posted an 81-run third-wicket stand and helped MI register their first win this season following eight consecutive losses. MI scored 161/5 in 19.2 overs.

114.title: PV Sindhu argues with chair umpire and chief referee over point penalty, video goes viral
114.article_body: A video went viral showing Indian shuttler PV Sindhu arguing with the chair umpire and chief referee after being given one point penalty for taking time to serve in her Badminton Asia Championships semi-final against Japan's Akane Yamaguchi. Sindhu argued that Yamaguchi "wasn't ready" but officials stayed with their decision. Sindhu, who was leading at the time, lost the match.

115.title: Kuldeep is thriving in DC's positive environment: Ponting
115.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said the positive environment provided by the franchise is helping spinner Kuldeep Yadav to thrive in the ongoing season. Ponting added, "We're really pleased for him...and [making] sure we keep things in line with him and not let him get too far ahead of himself." Currently, Kuldeep is the second-highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022.

116.title: DMK stands for upliftment of workforce: TN CM Stalin on Labour Day
116.article_body: Speaking at an event on International Labour Day in Chennai, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Sunday that the DMK government stands for the upliftment of the workforce. "It is...DMK...that brought the use of bicycle rickshaws instead of hand-pulled rickshaws...For the first time in India, the DMK government provided free electricity to farmers in [Tamil Nadu]," he added.

117.title: Russian chiefs don't tell soldiers about expected losses: Zelenskyy
117.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday claimed that Russian commanders are lying to their soldiers and don't tell them about new losses expected. He alleged that they're not told that Russian army is preparing additional refrigerator trucks for "storing the bodies". "It's better for you to survive in Russia than to perish on our land," he said to Russian soldiers.

118.title: LSG to bat first against DC, Krishnappa Gowtham replaces Avesh Khan
118.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bat first against DC in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. DC are fielding an unchanged playing XI. LSG have made one change to their playing XI, with Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Avesh Khan. LSG are currently third on the points table, while DC are placed sixth.

119.title: Pune student beaten up with sticks at college event; 4 arrested
119.article_body: A student of the Sinhgad College of Arts, Science and Commerce in Pune was allegedly beaten up by a history-sheeter and his associates during an event at the college. Four people have been arrested in connection with the incident so far. They allegedly forced the student to sit on a two-wheeler and took him to a lane outside the college.

120.title: Bulldozers, aircraft deployed to fight massive wildfire in US
120.article_body: Over a thousand firefighters supported by bulldozers and aircraft were deployed to fight a massive wildfire in the United States. The fire reached closer to a city in northern New Mexico on Saturday. According to officials, the fire has grown in size from 266 sq-km to 393 sq-km and has destroyed at least 166 homes.

121.title: Jet fuel price up 3.22%, reaches record high after 2022's 9th hike
121.article_body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, was hiked by 3.22% on Sunday to an all-time high, reflecting a surge in global energy prices. ATF now costs ₹1,16,851.46/kl in Delhi, ₹1,15,617.24/kl in Mumbai, ₹1,21,430.48/kl in Kolkata and ₹1,20,728.03/kl in Chennai. ATF prices have increased by ₹42,829.55/kl, or over 50%, in nine consecutive hikes since January 1.

122.title: Each and every EV fire incident will be probed: Transport Secretary
122.article_body: Each and every incident of electric vehicles (EVs) catching fire will be investigated, Road Transport and Highways Secretary Giridhar Aramane told PTI. There have been multiple incidents of EVs catching fire recently, resulting in deaths and severe injuries to people. Aramane said an expert panel has been formed to enquire into the matter and it hasn't submitted its report yet.

123.title: SRK is one of my favourite action heroes; he uses his body so well: Tiger
123.article_body: When asked about his all-time favourite action hero in Bollywood, actor Tiger Shroff named actors Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar and Shah Rukh Khan. Speaking about Shah Rukh, Tiger said, "If you have seen his films, whether it's 'Darr' or 'Baazigar', when he gets hit he really reacts...He's an actor who uses his whole body so well. It's phenomenal."

124.title: Nobody ever told me to freeze my eggs: Payal on not being able to get pregnant
124.article_body: In an episode of 'Lock Upp', contestant Payal Rohatgi shared she cannot conceive. Speaking about it, she said, "I came from Ahmedabad to do something in life. I've been earning for my family since very young." "Nobody ever told me to freeze my eggs. While chasing, I didn't realise...I'll be so late that I can't become a mother," she added.

125.title: My visit to Europe comes at a time when it's facing many challenges: PM Modi
125.article_body: Ahead of his three-day trip to Denmark, Germany and France, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said he is travelling to Europe at a time when the region faces many challenges and choices. "Through my engagements, I intend to strengthen the spirit of cooperation with our European partners, who are important companions in India's quest for peace and prosperity," he said.

126.title: Team officials didn't have a say in this: CSK CEO on Jadeja handing back captaincy to MSD
126.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni, CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan said, "This is a decision taken by the team management and Jadeja." He added, "Team officials didn't have a say in this." He further said that Dhoni is taking up the responsibility in the larger interest of the franchise.

127.title: Man shoots alleged lover's brother dead in UP, then kills self
127.article_body: A 19-year-old man allegedly killed himself after he attacked a woman and her mother and shot dead her brother in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit on Saturday, police said. The man was reportedly in a relationship with the woman but her marriage was fixed to another person. The man shot the brother after the latter intervened when he attacked the two women.

128.title: IMD lists states where heatwave will continue in May
128.article_body: Northwest and central India will not get respite from the prevailing heatwave in May, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said. Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat are "expected to experience above-normal temperatures in May", IMD DG Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said. Western Rajasthan may report temperatures of over 50 degrees Celsius, he added.

129.title: BBMP extends deadline for 5% rebate on full property tax payment to May 31
129.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the rebate period on full payment of property tax till May 31. Earlier, the civic body had announced that people can get a 5% rebate if they pay their property tax for the 2022-23 financial year before April 30. The amount can be paid using BBMP's website.

130.title: Ahead of Eid, Hyd haleem store provides employment to over 1,000 youths
130.article_body: Amid the ongoing holy month of Ramadan, a haleem store in Hyderabad has provided employment opportunities to over 1,000 youths on a part-time basis. The store, Pista House, has reportedly employed several college students as cashiers and supervisors across its several outlets in the state. Over 400 persons have also been employed to prepare the dish (haleem), store's owner said.

131.title: World's richest man Elon Musk shares investment advice for 'long-term'
131.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk shared investment advice after tweeting he's been "asked a lot" about it. "Buy stock in several companies that make products & services that *you* believe in...Only sell if you think their products & services are trending worse," Musk tweeted. He added, "Don't panic when the market does...This will serve you well in the long-term."

132.title: Pelosi highest-ranking US official to visit Ukraine after war, Zelenskyy shares video
132.article_body: US Speaker of the House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi has become the highest-ranking US official to visit Ukraine since the war with Russia began. Pelosi met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. Sharing a video of Pelosi's visit on Twitter, Zelenskyy wrote, "The United States is a leader in Ukraine's strong support in the fight against Russian aggression."

133.title: 32-year-old man arrested for harassing woman in Mumbai
133.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a man (32) for allegedly harassing and passing lewd comments at a woman (28) in the city's Andheri (West) area. The accused, identified as Govind Chavan, whistled at the complainant and later, commented on the complainant's dress when he was confronted by her, she alleged. Notably, Chavan's lawyer has claimed that the accused has been "falsely implicated".

134.title: 1 killed, several injured in shooting at US’ Mississippi festival
134.article_body: One person was reportedly killed and several others were injured in a shooting incident that took place at the Mississippi Mudbug Festival in the US. According to Hinds County Sheriff Tyree Jones, several people with unknown injuries were taken to hospitals. The event, being hosted at the Mississippi State Fairgrounds, includes live entertainment, cooking contests and amusement park rides.

135.title: If you offered me all the Bitcoin in the world for $25, I wouldn't take it: Buffett
135.article_body: Warren Buffett, the world's sixth richest person and Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, said if someone offered him all of the Bitcoin in the world for $25, he wouldn't take it. "What would I do with it? I'd have to sell it back to you one way or another," the 91-year-old added. Buffett also said that Bitcoin doesn't produce anything tangible.

136.title: Blake Lively to make film directorial debut with adaptation of 'Seconds'
136.article_body: American actress Blake Lively is all set to make her feature film directorial debut with an adaptation of the graphic novel 'Seconds', by Scott Pilgrim creator Bryan Lee O'Malley. Last year, Blake helmed the music video for Taylor Swift's 'I Bet You Think About Me', which received an Academy of Country Music Award nomination for Video of the Year.

137.title: I might be GT captain, but there's no hierarchy in team: Hardik Pandya
137.article_body: After registering their eighth win from nine games in IPL 2022, GT captain Hardik Pandya said he couldn't have asked for a better debut season for the franchise. "I don't like to grow as an individual. I like to grow with my teammates...That's the reason [for] our success as well...I might be the captain, but there's no hierarchy," he added.

138.title: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases, 3 containment zones emerge in Bengaluru
138.article_body: Three containment zones have been reported in Bengaluru. Two containment zones have been reported in Mahadevapura and one in Bengaluru South. Reports said that the city had over 100 containment zones during the third COVID-19 wave. The Karnataka government has also instructed officials to start surveillance measures for those arriving from Japan and Thailand.

139.title: GST collection hits all time high of ₹1.68 lakh crore in April 2022
139.article_body: The GST revenue collection for April 2022 was at its highest ever at ₹1.68 lakh crore, Finance Ministry said. It's ₹25,000 crore more than the next highest collection of ₹1,42,095 crore in March 2022. Of the ₹1.68 lakh crore collected in April 2022, CGST is ₹33,159 crore, SGST is ₹41,793 crore, IGST is ₹81,939 crore and cess is ₹10,649 crore.

140.title: KGF: Chapter 2's Hindi version crosses ₹350-crore mark
140.article_body: The Hindi version of Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' has crossed the ₹350-crore mark at the box office. It is the tenth film in Hindi to cross the ₹300-crore mark, and the first to do so after the COVID-19 pandemic began. The film also stars Sanjay Dutt, Srinidhi Shetty, Raveena Tandon and Prakash Raj.

141.title: Ant-Man 3 to release on Feb 17, The Marvels to hit theatres on July 28
141.article_body: The release dates of Marvel Studios' 'The Marvels' and 'Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania' were swapped by Disney on Friday. 'Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania', previously scheduled to release on July 28, 2023, will now release on February 17. The release date of 'The Marvels', the sequel to 'Captain Marvel', has been moved to July 28, 2023 from February 17.

142.title: 5 people attacked me, beat me up with sticks and clubs: Influencer Kili Paul
142.article_body: Tanzanian influencer Kili Paul, who is known for lip-syncing to Indian film songs, took to Instagram Stories and revealed that he was attacked by five people. He added that he suffered an injury on his right thumb after a knife attack. "I got 5 stitches and I was beaten by sticks and clubs," he wrote.

143.title: Man flashes private parts at women, tries to hold their hands at Mangaluru mosque
143.article_body: A 26-year-old man in Karnataka's Mangaluru has been arrested for allegedly flashing his private parts at women inside a mosque. The accused has been identified as Sujith Shetty. Shetty entered the mosque and tried to hold the hands of several women and misbehaved with them and even flashed his private parts at them and disrupted the programme, said police officers.

144.title: SP MLA assaults power station worker over outage in UP; booked
144.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Ashutosh Maurya and his supporters have been booked for allegedly assaulting a power sub-station operator in UP's Budaun. Maurya reportedly claimed that he visited the station after receiving complaints about power outage from local residents. A video that surfaced on social media showed the MLA misbehaving with the operator, said police.

145.title: Suryakumar hugs angry Chahal to console him over DRS call, video goes viral
145.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav hugged RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal to console him after Umpire's Call in the DRS denied him Suryakumar's wicket in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. In a video that went viral, Chahal seemed angry after the review. "I didn’t tell him anything and it was just a sweet banter between him and me," Suryakumar later said.

146.title: 53,942 loudspeakers removed, sound level of 60,295 reduced: UP Police
146.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police said that they have removed 53,942 loudspeakers from various religious places till 7:00 am on Sunday. "The sound level of 60,295 loudspeakers was reduced and brought down to the level of standard parameters," Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) in Uttar Pradesh, Prashant Kumar said. Districts had earlier been asked to submit a compliance report.

147.title: Hardik has been better than many great batters at the moment: Harbhajan
147.article_body: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has said Hardik Pandya can bat at number three or four for Team India and there's no need for him to be sent down the order. "Hardik has been better than many other great batters at the moment...You can have someone else as a finisher," stated Harbhajan. Currently, Hardik is the third-highest scorer in IPL 2022.

148.title: I'm in a happy space with Shivashish; don't want to jump into marriage: Zareen
148.article_body: When asked about her wedding plans with her boyfriend, former Bigg Boss contestant Shivashish Mishra, actress Zareen Khan said no marriage is on the cards. "I've realised that Shiv is very similar to me, the kind of person I am," she added. "I'm in a very happy space with Shivashish right now; I don’t want to jump...into marriage," Zareen said.

149.title: Bombay HC upholds life-term of Pune man who stabbed aunt 54 times
149.article_body: Bombay High Court has upheld a session court's order sentencing a 33-year-old man from Pune to life imprisonment on charges of murdering his maternal aunt by stabbing her 54 times. The accused had claimed that no motive had been attributed to him for committing the crime. The accused was 21 years old at the time of the murder.

150.title: Want to do films that justify the time I'll spend away from my child: Anushka
150.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma said that she has always been a "seeker of balance" in her work and personal life. She added, "I will always want to be a part of the best scripts that come my way." Anushka said she's focusing on the scripts that will make it worth her time to stay away from her daughter Vamika.

151.title: Bengaluru police help take man who fell unconscious to hospital
151.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Namma 112 on Saturday tweeted that police officers have helped deliver an unidentified man, who is in his 30s, to a hospital after they found that he had fallen unconscious. The officers had arrived at the spot after receiving information that a man was seen lying on the road. The officers had immediately called an ambulance.

152.title: Most undertrials are poor, should get bail wherever possible: PM
152.article_body: PM Narendra Modi appealed to the Chief Ministers of states and the Chief Justices of High Courts to prioritise cases of undertrials. "There are over 3.5 lakh prisoners in jails who are undertrials. A majority of these are poor or from ordinary families," said PM Modi. Bail must be granted to them wherever possible, he added.

153.title: 'Pan-India' is a disrespectful word for movies, it should be removed: Actor Siddharth
153.article_body: Talking about several regional films being referred to as 'pan-India films', actor Siddharth said, "Pan-India is a very disrespectful word." He added, "The term is being used to describe that a regional film means there is something called an Indian film, which comes from Bollywood." "The term pan-India should be removed...it should just be called an Indian film," Siddharth stated.

154.title: Andrew Garfield confesses he was texting friends after Will slapped Chris at Oscars
154.article_body: Andrew Garfield has admitted he was texting friends after Will Smith slapped presenter Chris Rock during the 2022 Academy Awards.  He said, "Everyone's texting me, asking me, like, what the vibe in the room is. At that moment, my friends took priority over Kevin." Notably, Kevin Costner was introducing the director nominees when Garfield was pictured texting on his phone.

155.title: Some people giving communal colour: Tejashwi on loudspeaker row
155.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy around the use of loudspeakers in religious places, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that some people are giving a "communal colour to unnecessary issues". "I want to ask a question...They (loudspeakers) were invented in 1925 and have been used in temples and mosques...since the 1970s. Didn't God exist when loudspeakers were not there?" Yadav tweeted.

156.title: Patiala clash 'mastermind' Barjinder Singh Parwana arrested from Mohali
156.article_body: Barjinder Singh Parwana, the alleged mastermind and main conspirator behind the recent violent clashes in Patiala, has been arrested. Range Inspector General MS Chhina said that Parwana was arrested from Mohali. A clash had broken out between members of Shiv Sena, who had called for an 'anti-Khalistan' march, and Sikh activists and Nihangs outside the Kali Mata temple.

157.title: Win means a lot, it hasn't been easy for us, we need to stick together: Ishan
157.article_body: MI opener Ishan Kishan has said their win against RR "means a lot" as it hasn't been easy for them in the ongoing IPL season. "We need to stick together...Hopefully, we win a few more matches," he added. On his 26-run innings, Ishan said, "Intent was to get boundaries in the powerplay to make it easier for the other batters."

158.title: 26-yr-old man steals 4 litres of milk from shop in Delhi, arrested
158.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing four litres of milk from a shop in Delhi's Kalkaji area on Saturday. Police said that the shopkeeper saw the man stealing four packets of milk and caught him red-handed. The shopkeeper then called the police, handed the man over and gave a written complaint.

159.title: Angelina Jolie rushes to bomb shelter in Ukraine amid air raid warning, video surfaces
159.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actress Angelina Jolie running towards a bomb shelter after an air raid siren went off in Ukraine's Lviv amid war with Russia. In the video, Jolie can be seen rushing out of a building with a group and saying, "I'm okay" to the camera. Earlier, she was filmed at a cafe, meeting some locals.

160.title: I was blown away by Sonali's bald look, asked Ayushmann 'Can I shave': Tahira
160.article_body: When asked what was the inspiration behind her bald look after her cancer treatment, Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap said she was blown away by Sonali Bendre's bald look after the latter's chemotherapy. "I was...34 when I saw that and I thought, 'What a woman'," she added. "So, when this was happening...I asked Ayushmann if I should shave," Tahira added.

161.title: 'What's the obsession with lip-syncing?' Twitter user asks Diljit, he responds
161.article_body: Singer Diljit Dosanjh responded to a Twitter user who accused him of lip-syncing during one of his performances at a concert. "What's the obsession with lip-syncing?" the user wrote while reacting to a video of Diljit performing at the Born To Shine World Tour in Jalandhar. "Lip Syncing...WTH? It's live, man. Don't disrespect the musicians," Diljit responded.

162.title: 21-yr-old rape accused jumps off Faridabad court building, dies
162.article_body: A 21-year-old man, accused of rape, jumped from the sixth floor of a court building and died in Faridabad after his bail plea hearing on Saturday. The deceased was arrested last year for allegedly kidnapping and raping a minor. He had secured an interim bail later. His father claimed that the girl's parents were demanding money from him.

163.title: Karnataka man makes wife burn camphor on hand in 'fidelity test'
163.article_body: The police have launched a search for a man who allegedly forced his wife to burn camphor on her hand in a "fidelity test" in Veerenahalli village in Karnataka's Kolar. The police were informed about the matter after the head of an NGO got involved. The wife reportedly had not complained due to fear of retribution from her husband.

164.title: 18-year-old nurse found hanging from hospital wall in UP's Unnao, family allege rape
164.article_body: The body of an 18-year-old nurse was found hanging by a rope from the outer wall of a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao district on Saturday. The woman's family alleged that she was gangraped and murdered and lodged an FIR naming four people including the owner of hospital, police said. Notably, the deceased had joined the hospital a day before.

165.title: Odisha announces 6-9 am teaching timings in schools amid record heat
165.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave, Odisha has rescheduled the timings of teaching hours in schools. "Government after careful consideration, has been pleased to reschedule the timing of teaching hours in all schools from 6.00 am to 9.00 am wef 2nd May, 2022. However, the examination already scheduled by different Boards/Councils will continue as usual," the government notification read.

166.title: People asked us to do a lip filler, get a nose job: Singers Prakriti & Sukriti
166.article_body: Twin singers Prakriti and Sukriti Kakar said people asked them to do a lip filler and get a nose job done. "We both have typical Punjabi noses, so a lot of people used to be like maybe you should try it," the twins said. "For me, body positivity...means feeling good in your skin no matter...what shape you're in," Prakriti added.

167.title: He always carried cash in Gucci bag for no particular reason: Deb remembers Taz
167.article_body: Singer-songwriter Deb remembered singer Tarsame Singh Saini, popularly known as Taz from Stereo Nation, who passed away on Saturday at the age of 54. "He was always carrying loads of cash in his Gucci sling bag for no particular reason. 'You never know; I might need it!'," Deb said, adding, "He was fighting his own battles."

168.title: It was wet all over the place, so I felt we were 10-15 runs short: Ashwin
168.article_body: After their five-wicket defeat against MI, RR spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said their 158-run total was 10-15 runs short as there was "heavy dew" during the second innings. "It was wet all over the place...and it makes a massive difference, good deliveries tend to get over-pitched," he added. Ashwin picked one wicket, conceding 21 runs in his four overs.

169.title: 4.5kg of Ephedrine drug worth ₹90 lakh seized at Bengaluru airport
169.article_body: A consignment of the Ephedrine drug, weighing over 4.49kg, was seized from the International Courier Terminal at the Bengaluru airport by various agencies. The drug consignment, which amounted to over ₹89.92 lakh, was hidden inside a parcel along with readymade garments and was ready to get despatched to Australia, a Customs official said. Notably, the exporter is a Vijayawada resident.

170.title: Made an original song, just used an old line: Kanika on being accused of stealing Pak song
170.article_body: After Pakistani singer Hadiqa Kiani accused Kanika Kapoor of copying her song 'Boohey Barian', Kanika said, "We made an original song." She added, "It's not a cover version, it's a new song completely." Kanika further said they just used a "hook line" from an old Punjabi folk song. She stated that they had no intention of stealing anybody's work.

171.title: Jos Buttler records most runs ever in an IPL season by an RR player
171.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler has recorded the most runs ever in an IPL season by an RR player. With his 52-ball 67-run knock against MI, Buttler took his tally of runs in IPL 2022 to 566 in just nine matches. Buttler overtook Ajinkya Rahane, who had held the previous record with 560 runs for RR in IPL 2012.

172.title: 32-yr-old man dies as Haryana Roadways bus hits bike in Gurugram
172.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Tekchand, was killed and his colleague, Lal Mohan, was injured after a Haryana Roadways bus allegedly hit the motorcycle they were travelling on. Police said that the victims were rushed to the hospital where Tekchand was declared dead on arrival. Police said that FIR has been registered in the case.

173.title: Germany moves ICJ to deny Italy reparations for Nazi atrocities
173.article_body: Germany has registered a case in the International Court of Justice (ICJ) to stop Italy from claiming reparations over Nazi atrocities during World War II. This comes ahead of an Italian court ruling on whether to auction German-owned buildings. On several occasions in the past, Italian courts have directed Germany to pay for damages due to the Nazi atrocities.

174.title: 2nd bombing in 2 days in Afghanistan's Kabul ahead of Eid; 1 dead
174.article_body: One woman was killed and three others were injured after a bomb blast in a passenger van in Afghanistan's Kabul on Saturday, in the second incident in two days ahead of Eid al-Fitr, an official told Reuters. Earlier, over 50 worshippers were killed in a bomb blast at a mosque there. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack, Reuters reported.

175.title: Viral pic of crying young woman is fake, Zelenskyy's daughter didn't escape to Poland
