"While she was there, people were in and out of our home constantly. Besides, there were several nurses and house-helps to look after her. Now it's just me in house," Usha added.

350.title: South Africa may be entering 5th wave of COVID-19: Health Minister
350.article_body: Health Minister Joe Phaahla said South Africa may be entering its fifth wave of COVID-19. The Omicron variant of COVID-19 was first reported in South Africa last November. The country has reported over 3.7 million cases and over 100,000 deaths since the pandemic began. Phaahla added South Africa has already passed the threshold of 6,237 new cases per day.

351.title: You'll always be my Captain: Musk as Shatner says 'hire me as Twitter's face'
351.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "You will always be my Captain," after actor William Shatner asked Musk to hire him "as the face of Twitter". The 91-year-old played the role of Captain James T Kirk of USS Enterprise in 'Star Trek' franchise. Shatner also wrote, "Since it seems to be the latest "thing"...I'm stating that I'm staying on Twitter."

352.title: Mohammad Shami uses tape to measure his run-up in between over, umpire talks to him
352.article_body: GT fast bowler Mohammad Shami called for a measuring tape to mark his run-up after bowling just one delivery against RCB in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. The umpire was seen talking to Shami, seemingly unhappy with the delay. Before measuring the run-up, Shami had a couple of false starts.

353.title: 6 severely injured after DTC bus crashes into roadside shops in Delhi's Jangpura
353.article_body: At least six persons were severely injured after a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus crashed into roadside shops in Delhi's Jangpura on Saturday, police said. "The bus was going towards Jangpura from the Sarai Kale Khan area. The driver of the bus lost control," an officer said. Following the accident, the area reportedly witnessed a massive traffic jam.

354.title: Kim Kardashian cleared of defamation charges against Blac Chyna
354.article_body: Television personality Kim Kardashian was on Friday cleared of defamation charges against Blac Chyna. A Los Angeles court concluded Kim made "no statement" that was "alleged to be defamatory" against Chyna, reports said. This comes after Blac Chyna sued the Kardashian-Jenner family for purposefully interfering with her contract on the Rob and Chyna spin-off of 'Keeping Up With the Kardashians'.

355.title: Part of bridge caves in after rodents dig soil underneath in Punjab
355.article_body: A portion of the footpath on the Jagraon Bridge in Punjab's Ludhiana caved in after rodents dug the soil and excavated the area underneath, according to officials. The district's Additional Deputy Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal inspected the area on Friday with other officials and ordered its immediate repair. The matter came to light after an activist posted about it online.

356.title: B'luru likely to see rains, thundershowers over next few days: IMD
356.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Bengaluru city is likely to witness scattered rainfall in the coming days. The weather department said the city is likely to witness partly cloudy sky, rain and thundershowers from May 1 to May 6. Reportedly, Bengaluru witnessed the hottest day of the year on April 29 with the city's maximum temperature touching 35.2°C.

357.title: Surprised: De Kock on LSG's 20-run win after posting 153/8 vs PBKS
357.article_body: LSG wicketkeeper-batter Quinton de Kock said he was surprised by his side's 20-run win against PBKS in IPL 2022, adding they couldn't put up a total they wanted to. "But the guys bowled really well. We have got a lot to thank them for," he added. Asked to bat first, LSG posted 153/8 in 20 overs.

358.title: Mental health issues in kids rose during pandemic: Study
358.article_body: Based on an analysis of 17 studies, researchers have found that mental issues in children rose during COVID-19 pandemic. "In many places, schools,...mental health resources...became unavailable...making it difficult for children...to receive timely mental healthcare," a researcher said. High rates of anxiety, depression, sleep disorders, suicidal behaviour, etc. were reported during this period.

359.title: Bihar Police cautions people as fraudsters steal money in name of electricity bill
359.article_body: The Bihar Police has cautioned people against responding to messages from cyber fraudsters asking people to pay money claiming that their previous month's electricity bill wasn't updated. The fraudsters ask people to contact a number provided in the message, the police said. The caution comes after several people including ex-Bihar Police Chief and a HC judge received such messages.

360.title: Month of May to see fewer heatwaves over major parts of country: IMD
360.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Saturday forecasted fewer heatwaves and below normal maximum temperatures for the month of May over major parts of the country. However, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Delhi, Haryana, Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh will continue to experience heatwave to severe heatwave conditions during the month, the IMD added.

361.title: The word 'metaverse' is hypothetical, we don't use it: Snap CEO
361.article_body: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel has said his company doesn't use the word "metaverse" because it's "pretty ambiguous and hypothetical". He said, "Just ask a room of people how to define it, and everyone's definition is...different." "When we talk about AR, we're trying to augment the real world around you. Our fundamental bet is that people...love the real world," he added.

362.title: ₹5,551 crore seized from Xiaomi India bank accounts for forex violations: ED
362.article_body: Assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited have been seized in connection with "illegal outward remittances made by the company", the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said on Saturday. The assets lying in bank accounts have been seized under provisions of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999, the agency added.

363.title: PMC to resume toy train services in Pune gardens after gap of 2 yrs
363.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to resume the toy train services in its gardens in the city after a gap of about two years. The vehicle depot has been asked to start the trains as early as possible in the wake of approaching school vacations, a senior official said. The toy trains will be operated at five gardens.

364.title: It's a victory of truth: Vivek as Kashmir Files completes 50 days in theatres
364.article_body:
Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', which was released on March 11, has completed 50 days in theatres. Taking to Twitter, Vivek wrote, "It's a victory of Truth. It's a victory of Humanity. It's truly a people's film. Thanks, everyone. #RightToJustice." It starred Anupam Kher, 
Pallavi Joshi, Mithun Chakraborty and Darshan Kumaar among others in pivotal roles.

365.title: SpaceX apologises for 'falling behind' in Starlink customer support
365.article_body: SpaceX has apologised to some customers for falling behind in its response time in Starlink customer support. "This is not the level of support we aim to provide," it said in a message posted on Reddit by a customer. Starlink added there may be an "unusual delay" before they reply to customers and someone from the team will respond "eventually".

366.title: CBI raids 8 locations in Mumbai, Pune over Yes Bank-DHFL fraud case
366.article_body: CBI on Saturday conducted raids at eight locations in Mumbai and Pune in connection with a fraud case related to Yes Bank and Dewan Housing Finance Limited. Searches were conducted at the premises linked to Pune-based businessman Avinash Bhosale & Mumbai's prominent real estate developers Vinod Goenka and Shahid Balwa. Reportedly, they've close links with the Shiv Sena-led Maharashtra government.

367.title: RCB to bat first against GT, Hardik Pandya featuring in his 100th IPL match
367.article_body: RCB won the toss and elected to bat first against GT in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. GT captain Hardik Pandya is featuring in his 100th IPL match. GT have made two changes, with Pradeep Sangwan and Sai Sudharsan replacing Yash Dayal and Abhinav Manohar, respectively. Meanwhile, Mahipal Lomror has replaced Suyash Prabhudessai in RCB's playing XI.

368.title: Munich’s Oktoberfest to return without COVID-19 restrictions: Mayor
368.article_body: Munich's Mayor Dieter Reiter on Friday said Oktoberfest, the world's largest annual beer festival, will return in 2022 without any COVID-19 restrictions. It was cancelled the previous two years due to COVID-19. The festival usually attracts over six million people to Munich each year. Reiter added he told the festival's management to go ahead "without delay and without restrictions".

369.title: I could have done things differently: CEO Parag on Twitter's past performance
369.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal acknowledged during a company-wide meeting that the microblogging site could have performed better over the years. "Yes, we could have done things differently and better. I could have done things differently. I think about that a lot," Agrawal said. He also urged the company's staff to expect change in the future under new leadership.

370.title: Unlike actors, we can't choose our songs in films: Shalmali Kholgade
370.article_body: Shalmali Kholgade, in a recent interview, said singers don't have an option of choosing their songs in films. "We can turn a song down if...we are not comfortable singing the lyrics, but we cannot equate it to actors choosing to take up a role," Shalmali said. She added that many singers nowadays don't know who they are singing for.

371.title: Over 1 million people evacuated from Ukraine to Russia: Lavrov
371.article_body: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Saturday said over one million people have been evacuated to Russia from Ukraine since February 24, which is when Russia's invasion of Ukraine began. Lavrov said the 1.02 million includes 120,000 foreigners. Lavrov added that 2.8 million people in Ukraine have asked to be evacuated into Russia.

372.title: Making efforts so youth of ordinary families become entrepreneurs: PM Modi
372.article_body: Speaking at the inauguration of Global Patidar Business Summit (GPBS), Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the government has been making constant efforts through its policies for the past eight years to help the youth of ordinary families become entrepreneurs. "We just have to boost our self-confidence. This...will come only when there's participation of everyone in development," he said.

373.title: Netflix fires staff months after hiring them, offers 2 weeks of severance pay
373.article_body: Netflix confirmed to Fortune that it has fired 25 employees from its marketing department, including 10-12 writers and editors from its in-house publication Tudum. Several of these writers tweeted that they were fired just months after being hired with the promise of more stability. A fired Netflix employee tweeted the company offered two weeks of severance pay to fired workers.

374.title: PMC urges eligible citizens to get 2nd COVID vaccine dose at earliest
374.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has appealed to all eligible citizens to get their second COVID-19 vaccine dose at the earliest to protect themselves from a possible next wave of the virus. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar also urged the citizens eligible for the precaution dose to take it. Reportedly, about five lakh persons are yet to complete their vaccination process in Pune.

375.title: SC orders release of detained Pak man who got married, had 5 kids in India
375.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday ordered the release of a 62-year-old Pakistani man who's in a detention centre for overstaying his visa on a personal bond of ₹5,000 and two sureties. The man had entered India on a visa in 1989-90, got married and had five children. The court directed the Centre to decide on granting the man a long-term visa.

376.title: Musk made $500,000 donation in Amber's name after her divorce settlement, court told
376.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk's fund is believed to have made a $500,000 donation to American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) in his ex-girlfriend Amber Heard's name, the actress' defamation trial was told. The amount was almost half the donation that Heard has made to the charity. She had pledged to give away her $7 million divorce settlement with Johnny Depp.

377.title: Took risk of quitting Shiv Sena for benefit of OBCs: NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal
377.article_body: NCP leader and Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Chhagan Bhujbal said that he took a big risk by quitting Shiv Sena and joining Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) for the sake of the Other Backward Classes (OBCs). "For the last several years, I have been working for the OBC community. I risked my political career for their benefit and switched over," he said.

378.title: Pune railway station to get 107 more CCTV cameras for enhanced vigilance
378.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) is going to add 107 CCTV cameras at Pune railway station. At least 61 cameras are already present at the station premises. "We have cracked several cases with the help of CCTV cameras till now, and adding more cameras will help to improve our vigilance and crime detection," a senior police inspector said.

379.title: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos loses over $20 billion in a day
379.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos lost around $20.5 billion in a day after Amazon reported its first quarterly loss since 2015, with net loss of $3.8 billion in first quarter of 2022. Bezos, the world's second richest person according to Bloomberg, is now reportedly the third biggest wealth loser this year, with his fortune dropping nearly $44 billion since January 1.

380.title: AIMIM leader held in Hubballi violence case attempts suicide in custody
380.article_body: AIMIM leader Mohammed Arif Nagral, who was arrested in connection with the Karnataka's Hubballi violence, attempted suicide in police custody by consuming turpentine, ANI reported. He was hospitalised following the incident and is undergoing treatment in Hubballi's KIMS Hospital. A stone-pelting incident took place at Old Hubballi Police Station on April 16, in which 12 policemen were injured.

381.title: Comic book artist Neal Adams, who drew Batman & Avengers, dies at 80
381.article_body: Neal Adams, the comic book artist who drew superhero characters like Batman, Green Arrow, Green Lantern, the Avengers and several others, passed away aged 80 on Thursday. He died in New York of complications from sepsis, his wife told Hollywood Reporter. In a statement, DC Comics called Neal "one of the most acclaimed artists to have contributed to...comic book industry".

382.title: He should be paying Mike for that punch: Fury on Tyson punching a man
382.article_body: Reacting to a video of American boxing legend Mike Tyson punching a fellow passenger on a flight, British boxer Tyson Fury said, "[The passenger] should be paying Mike. He can say he's been punched...by a legend." "I would pay for that myself," added Fury. "If he's man enough to...touch...and abuse Tyson, then...take a punch in the face," stated Fury.

383.title: After Weibo, China's WeChat to reveal user locations on posts
383.article_body: China's messaging service WeChat has said it will start revealing the location of users when they post on a public account. It will soon begin testing the setting which applies only to users of its "public platform", where they may comment on content published by official accounts. This comes right after Weibo started publishing users' IP locations.

384.title: ED attaches Jacqueline's ₹7-crore FD in case involving conman Sukesh: Reports
384.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has attached Jacqueline Fernandez's ₹7-crore fixed deposit in money laundering case involving jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar, according to reports. Last year, ED said Sukesh gifted three Gucci and Chanel bags, two Gucci outfits, two pairs of diamond earrings and two Hermes bracelets to her. She also received a Mini Cooper, which she returned, according to ED.

385.title: The current Man Utd squad needs an open-heart surgery: Gary Neville
385.article_body: Talking about the current Manchester United squad, ex-Manchester United player Gary Neville said, "I still can't believe [that] going from a European Cup final last year and finishing second, that open-heart surgery is needed...but it quite simply is." "There is no certainty anymore," added Neville. Manchester United are currently sixth on the Premier League points table.

386.title: PV Sindhu wins bronze medal at Badminton Asia Championships
386.article_body: World number seven PV Sindhu has won a bronze medal in the 2022 Badminton Asia Championships following a defeat in the semi-finals of the tournament, against Japanese defending champion Akane Yamaguchi. Yamaguchi defeated Sindhu 13-21, 21-19, 21-16. Sindhu had won a bronze medal at the 2014 edition of the tournament in Gimcheon as well.

387.title: Far-right US activist told he may get his Twitter account back soon: WSJ
387.article_body: Charles Johnson, a far-right activist in the US, has been told by a close associate of Elon Musk that he may "soon" get his account back after Musk buys Twitter, according to a Wall Street Journal report. Johnson was banned from Twitter in 2015 after he used the platform to fundraise to "take out" Black Lives Matter activist DeRay McKesson.

388.title: Don't tell reason, solve the problem: Akhilesh to UP govt on power crisis
388.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the UP government for "telling reasons" instead of solving the power crisis problem in the state. Yadav said this by tweeting an excerpt of information shared by state's Urban Development & Energy Minister AK Sharma which revealed the closure of a few power generation units in the state due to technical reasons.

389.title: 3 children of a Surat-based slum locality drown in Tapi river
389.article_body: Three children drowned while playing on the bank of the Tapi river in Surat, Gujarat. The three deceased, who were residents of the Iqbal Nagar slum area, were identified as Mohammad Fakir (7), Shahadat Fakir (8) and Sania Sheikh (14). "The trio drowned due to a sudden rise in the river's water level near the causeway," a police official said.

390.title: Acid attack on 24-yr-old woman in B'luru is barbarous: K'taka Min
390.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar on Saturday called the acid attack on a 24-year-old woman in Bengaluru "barbarous". "Police expressed confidence that they'll be arresting the accused in a day or two. [State government] will look after victim's treatment," he said. Reportedly, the accused had stalked the woman for years and had attacked her after she refused his marriage proposal.

391.title: Apple sued in Russia for pulling its payment service amid war
391.article_body: Russian law firm Chernyshov, Lukoyanov & Partners has sued Apple seeking $1.28 million in damages for consumers affected by Apple withdrawing its payment service from Russia amid the Ukrainian war. The demand includes compensation for "moral damage" caused to citizens. The total figure could rise as the law firm is still inviting more claimants to join the suit.

392.title: Maharashtra's 1st child-friendly room started at Pune rly station
392.article_body: Maharashtra's first child-friendly room or counselling room was launched at Pune railway station on Friday by the district's Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) Renu Sharma. This was done in a bid to provide help to 'runaway' or missing children. "This is the first step towards making our stations free of any kind of child trafficking or violence," Sharma said.

393.title: 7 held for a road brawl in Delhi over petty issue: Police
393.article_body: Delhi Police arrested seven men for allegedly assaulting each other and injuring two passers-by in a road brawl on Thursday near a school in northwest Delhi's Shakurpur area. While locals alleged they were involved in stone-pelting and communal hatred, police confirmed it was just a fight over a petty issue. The injured were taken to a hospital and discharged later.

394.title: Rohit Shetty to make biopic on ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner Rakesh Maria
394.article_body: Rohit Shetty announced on Saturday that he will be producing a biopic on former Mumbai Police Commissioner Rakesh Maria. "Feel honoured to be bringing this real-life supercop's journey to screen," Rohit wrote on Instagram. Rakesh Maria is a 1981 batch IPS officer who cracked the Bombay serial blasts case in 1993 and investigated the 26/11 Mumbai attacks.

395.title: No COVID testing, vaccination certificates for Char Dham Yatra: U'khand govt
395.article_body: It is not mandatory for the Char Dham Yatra passengers and devotees arriving from the state borders to undergo COVID-19 testing or present a COVID-19 vaccination certificate, an official confirmed. It's, however, mandatory for all the devotees to register on the state's tourism portal before their arrival, the official added. The Char Dham Yatra commences on May 3.

396.title: UP man kidnaps own granddaughter to 'gift' to his lover
396.article_body: A 56-year-old man from UP's Bijnor who works as a daily wager in Delhi kidnapped his one-month-old granddaughter and allegedly "gifted" her to a married and childless woman with whom he was having an affair. The woman had reportedly expressed her wish to adopt a baby to the accused identified as Mohd Zafar. The accused has now been arrested.

397.title: SRK's Knight Riders, MLC plan to build ₹230-crore cricket stadium in US
397.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's Knight Riders Group and Major League Cricket (MLC) are teaming up for plans to construct a cricket stadium in Southern California. The proposed site of the stadium is at Great Park in Irvine City, which is over 60 km southeast of downtown Los Angeles. The venue is expected to cost around $30 million (over ₹230 crore).

398.title: Willing to take over debt-ridden CR Park school: Delhi govt to HC
398.article_body: Delhi government has told Delhi High Court that it is willing to take over the debt-ridden CR Park's Raisina Bengali School. A request has been made to the Comptroller and Auditor General to conduct an audit, it added. "If it's found...that money has been...diverted to somewhere else from the school account, very strict action will be taken," Delhi government stated.

399.title: General Manoj Pande takes over as 29th Chief of Army Staff from General MM Naravane
399.article_body: General Manoj Pande, PVSM, AVSM, VSM, ADC took over as the 29th Chief of Army Staff from General MM Naravane on Saturday. He is the first Corps of Engineers officer to hold the post. An alumnus of the National Defence Academy, he was commissioned in the Corps of Engineers (Bombay Sappers) in December 1982.

400.title: One should be mindful of the 'Lakshman Rekha' while discharging their duty: CJI
400.article_body: While speaking at the Joint Conference of Chief Ministers and Chief Justices of High Courts, which was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi, Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said one should be mindful of the 'Lakshman Rekha' while discharging their duty. "Constitution provides separation of power among three organs and the harmonious function between three organs strengthens democracy," he added.

401.title: Largest-known tooth from any ichthyosaur found in Swiss Alps
401.article_body: Palaeontologists have discovered sets of fossils, unearthed in the Swiss Alps between 1976 and 1990, representing three new ichthyosaurs that may have been among the largest animals to have ever lived. The discovery includes the largest ichthyosaur tooth ever found. The tooth has a 2.4 inches wide base and an estimated length of 6 inches.
